title: Fair Enough: Guaranteeing Approximate Maximin Shares
description: Fair division of $m$ indivisible goods among $n$ agents with additive valuations.
results: Theorem 2.1: For each $n ≥ 3$, there is an instance where an MMS allocation doesn't exist. $m$ may be exponential in $n$ in this instance.
Section 3: PTAS for $ρ$-MMS (i.e., $ρ(1-ε)$-MMS in polytime when $ε$ is constant), where $ρ = 2n'/(3n'-1) = (2/3)(1 + 1/(3n'-1))$ and $n'$ is the largest odd number such that $n' ≤ n$.
Corollary of Section 3: When $n$ is constant, we can pick $ε = 1/(3n')$ to get $2/3$-MMS in polytime. When $n ∈ \{3, 4\}$, $3/4$-MMS exists.
